intro: Silene ciliata var. elegans, commonly known as the elegant bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has hairy, slender stems and lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive ciliated edge. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. Silene ciliata var. elegans is a herbaceous perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its native range.
